review: I've been using the Fire Stick for several weeks now, and thus far, it (1) has slightly improved picture quality when viewing Netflix and other streaming services, (2) has been easy to navigate, and (3) its remote is far too easily lost in the depths of the family-room sofa and surrounding environs.  What were they *thinking* when they made the remote this small??  On top of its 'lose-ability,' its wee size makes it a tad more difficult to discern some of the icons (I have 20/20 vision, incidentally, as does my husband).  C'mon, Amazon, you can do better than this.  How about illuminating the icons, for a start?  But apart from this problem, it's a wonderful product.  And for those who don't especially like seeing dongles hanging this way and that and dinging your viewing aesthetics, the Stick inserts into an HDMI port just behind the edge of your set (ours is a new Samsung LED), and is thus invisible -- unless, of course, you're poking around the back of the TV.  We're very happy with our purchase, and I recommend the product.

review: I have 3 tvs and have been using a Roku on all of them.  I have NEVER had a problem.  I got a new puppy that chewed one of my remotes so I thought I would give the Fire stick a chance.  This item is horrible!  It skips and skips.  The longer you watch tv, the more it skips.  It gets so bad that it resets itself.  Save yourself a headache and just spend a few dollars more and get a ROKU!!!
